did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: World War II Poster Collection, circa 1939-1945

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: University of Arizona. Library. Special Collections

did.abstract: This is an artificial collection comprised of posters relating to World War II. Materials are from the United States, Germany, France, Russia, and Latin America.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: World War II Poster Collection (MS 527). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The processing of this artificial collection of posters began in 2003 but was not completed. Processing resumed in 2014 with materials related to the University of Arizona added. Future accretions to the collection are expected.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Posters created during World War II (1939-1945) were used as tools to encourage support for the war effort. The themes of posters varied, but the central theme primarily concerned increasing productivity in factories and make the general public aware of their wartime responsibilities. These posters were created by government agencies, businesses, and private organizations and were inexpensive to make and omnipresent due to the mediums accessibility within workplaces and public spaces. The visual aesthetics of these posters drew heavily from contemporary fine and commercial arts and used slogans, symbols, and graphics to appeal to basic human emotions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 3 series.

list.item: Series I:Posters Relating to Adolph Hitler, circa 1939-1945
Series II: Latin America Posters, circa 1939-1945
Series III: Miscellaneous World War II Posters, circa 1939-1945

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection has three series and is comprised of posters relating to World War II. The collection contains posters from the United States, France, Canada, Germany and Latin America with resistance to German imperialism and support of the war effort as the central theme. The first series is comprised of materials specifically dedicated to Adolf Hitler with posters from the United States and Germany. The second series contains posters from Latin America. The third series contains items from France, Russia, and the United States. The collection consists primarily of broadsides comprised primarily of text and graphic works by anonymous and well-known artists, including Kukryniksy and Arias Bernal. Languages present within the collection include English, French, Russian, Spanish and German.

did.unittitle: Series 1: Posters Relating to Adolph Hitler,

scopecontent.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by artists' last name and contains posters from the United States and Germany, with Hitler as the concurrent theme within all of the posters. Items are in English and German.

This series contains posters from Latin America, mainly Argentina from the time period and is arranged by artist's last name. Materials relate to the war effort and resistance to the axis powers. Items are in Spanish.

did.unittitle: Series 3: Miscellaneous World War II Posters,

scopecontent.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by country then by artist's last name. It contains French lithograph posters from the 1930's, hand painted Russian posters relating to World War II by Kukryniksy, and a United States poster by Koehler and Ancora. The French posters were a gift of Eula Wheeler. Items are in English, French, and Russian.

did.unittitle: France – Champseix, E. Paul. Le Cirque de Gaverine,
France – Commarmond, P. Plage de Malo les Bains Nord,
Russia - Kukryniksy. All posters are in Russian with captions in English (8 posters),
United States – Koehler / Ancora Poster, Winner R. Hoe and Co., Inc. Award – National War Poster Competition,
